We, the undersigned, petition parliament to fully debate alternatives to the current system of fractional reserve banking.

The recent financial crisis is a direct result of privately owned banking institutions having the power to issue and control our national currency though debt.

The control of money, which crosses all boundaries of race, religion, age, class, gender etc. is too important to be left in the hands of profit seeking individuals and we require our elected representatives to examine viable alternatives to the current inequity of fractional reserve banking and take back the power to issue and control our national money supply.
